message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.NI 

Reasoning: The paper deals with the transmission of polar codes over a binary memoryless symmetric channel, which falls under the category of information theory (cs.IT). The paper also discusses the error probability and the gap to capacity, which are important topics in coding theory (cs.CC). The trade-off between the gap to capacity and the error probability can be seen as a problem in optimization or control theory (cs.SI). The paper also mentions the Bhattacharyya parameter, which is a concept in probability theory and statistics (cs.DS). Finally, the discussion of error floors and their absence in polar codes relates to the design and analysis of communication networks (cs.NI).
